Glushshakh, Shaman of Gruumsh and Kurtulmak - kobold barbarian (Brb 17 / Druid 5 / Shifter 18)

Glushshakh was the child of a great Orcish Leader and a human sorceress raped by the Orcish warrior. His appearance is very orcish, so he has grown in a tribe, with pure blood orcs, in hate and savagery. He was stronger and smarter than his comrades, and became quickly the Shaman of the tribe. The draconic blood of his mother allowed him to shape as a powerful and silent Kobold with the strenght and terrific presence of an Orc, able to sneak and kill everything with the strenght of a warrior, able to evade fireballs and blades and then to kick frightful asses.

Image credits : Ertacaltinoz

Explanations of the build :

The aim of the build is to get all the best feats (but not skills) of the strenght builds and the dex builds. Another mean to obtain this result is the Rogue bard RDD way. Here we want less skills and more AB, attacks per round and the terrifying rage. The only way with a barbarian to get a high strengh and a high dex with terrifying rage and HIPS, improved evasion, is to shapeshange as a Kobold commando (and after Shifter level 17, as an Epic Kobold Commando). With this shape, your original strenght is kept, while your dex is pumped to 25. You gain 5d6 SA, HiPS, improved evasion and some other goodies. The uncanny dodge of the barbarian class allows to secure your dex AC while in Kobold shape. The barbarian Rages are usable when shapeshifted. So the synergies are strong, but you have no class with move silently as a class skill, so HiPS is going to be useless here... or not. There is enough room in this build to get ESF : move silently (MS). The kobold has a +10 bonus to MS, + the dex ability bonus (+7) : 48 final score unbuffed. That's efficient. The build has an unbuffed AB of 40, 46 while in Kobold shape, and four attacks per round, dev critical and a terrifying rage with an unbuffed DC of  50, a full Taunt skill (40) for spellcasters and high AC ennemies. Constitution 12 is a bit low for a barbarian, yout rages have a duration of 10 rounds (that's ok I think) and your HP are between 400 and 500 (normal shape, Kobold shape), with all those defensive tools and HiPS, that's really enough. The AC in mundane armors is 34 in Kobold shape, that's pretty good. Your items (rings, belt, boots and amulet) merge, your weapons in main hand, shield, helmet and armor also merge with the Kobold shape. So if you wear a + 8 weapon (shortsword or not) with haste, your kobold will be hasted with a + 8 shortsword (+ 2d4 acid damages + massive critical +3d6, + on-hit: poison 1d2 dexterity (DC 24)). I've tested the build in PVM, that's at low lewel a classic Barbarian with a shortsword (but you can use another weapon at this stage), and then it became a Monster, especially at epic levels.


Similar builds : 

Terrifying Kobold bynhaislip78  less optimal but with the same main idea

A different build but also a dev critter Kobold with a death attack DC of 40 (!!!), more sneaky and 18d6 SA, a bit more fragile (HP), one of my fav assassin builds, Mick Dagger's Yip, Yip you're dead

Some edits thanks to Thesquid. The race is no longer half-orc after the shapechange, so you loose strengh bonus and int and char malus.

So here a human version of the build. Later dev crit but you have blind fight, full listen and more HP. Less RP fun, more optimal except for dev crit. I think a very sooner dev crit worth the half-Orc choice if you want quick power, human matures later but is more powerful at the end. That's like the choice between the dark side of the force and the light side.
